keyMoments.title: Luffy's Bounty Triples to 300 Million
keyMoments.description: Luffy's bounty increases from 100 million to 300 million berries following the Enies Lobby incident, marking him as one of the most wanted pirates in the world.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Luffy as a major threat to the World Government and shows the consequences of declaring war on them.
keyMoments.quote: Three hundred million berries?! That's amazing!

bounties.reason: Leading the assault on Enies Lobby and declaring war on the World Government

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Bounty Doubles to 120 Million
keyMoments.description: Zoro's bounty increases from 60 million to 120 million berries, maintaining his 'Pirate Hunter' epithet.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms Zoro's status as the second-strongest Straw Hat and a major threat to the World Government.

bounties.reason: Defeating CP9 agents at Enies Lobby

keyMoments.title: Nami's First Bounty: 16 Million
keyMoments.description: Nami receives her first bounty of 16 million berries with the epithet 'Cat Burglar.'
keyMoments.significance: Officially recognizes Nami as a wanted pirate and navigator of the Straw Hat crew.

bounties.reason: Participating in the assault on Enies Lobby as the Straw Hat Pirates' navigator

reveals.information: First bounty of 16 million berries with epithet 'Cat Burglar'

keyMoments.title: Usopp's Failed Attempts to Rejoin
keyMoments.description: Usopp makes several comedic attempts to get back into the good graces of the Straw Hat crew but his efforts go unnoticed.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's desire to rejoin while maintaining his pride.

keyMoments.title: Usopp's First Bounty as Sogeking: 30 Million
keyMoments.description: Usopp receives a bounty of 30 million berries under his Sogeking alias. The World Government doesn't realize Sogeking and Usopp are the same person.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the government recognized Sogeking's role in burning the government flag at Enies Lobby.

bounties.reason: Burning the World Government flag at Enies Lobby as Sogeking

reveals.information: First bounty of 30 million berries under Sogeking alias

keyMoments.title: Sanji's First Bounty: 77 Million
keyMoments.description: Sanji receives his first bounty of 77 million berries with the epithet 'Black Leg.' His wanted poster features a poorly drawn sketch instead of a photograph.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Sanji's official recognition as a wanted pirate, though the drawing instead of a photo becomes a running gag.

bounties.reason: Defeating CP9 agents and involvement in closing the Gates of Justice at Enies Lobby

reveals.information: First bounty of 77 million berries with epithet 'Black Leg', poster is a drawing not a photo

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper's Insulting Bounty: 50 Berries
keyMoments.description: Chopper receives an insultingly low bounty of only 50 berries with the epithet 'Cotton Candy Lover.' The World Government mistook him for the crew's pet.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a long-running comedic element where Chopper's strength is completely unrecognized by the World Government.

bounties.reason: Mistaken for the Straw Hat Pirates' pet rather than a crew member

reveals.information: First bounty of only 50 berries, mistaken for a pet with epithet 'Cotton Candy Lover'

keyMoments.title: Robin's Bounty Increases to 80 Million
keyMoments.description: Robin's bounty increases slightly from 79 million to 80 million berries, maintaining her 'Devil Child' epithet.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin remains a high-value target for the World Government due to her ability to read Poneglyphs.

bounties.reason: Continuing threat due to ability to read Poneglyphs, survived Enies Lobby assault

keyMoments.title: Ship Construction Progress Update
keyMoments.description: Franky works late into the night with Iceburg and Galley-La foremen on the Straw Hat Pirates' new ship.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's dedication to building a worthy ship and carrying on Tom's legacy.

keyMoments.title: Tom's Legacy and Franky's Survival
keyMoments.description: Extended flashbacks reveal how Franky survived his near-death experience by rebuilding himself with scrap metal, becoming a cyborg.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Franky's transformation and connection to Tom.

keyMoments.title: Franky's Bounty Revealed: 44 Million
keyMoments.description: Franky receives his first bounty of 44 million berries with the epithet 'Cyborg' for his involvement in the Enies Lobby incident.
keyMoments.significance: Franky's wanted status means he can no longer safely remain in Water 7, pushing him toward joining the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Franky's Initial Refusal to Join
keyMoments.description: Despite his wanted status, Franky initially refuses to join the Straw Hat Pirates, expressing loyalty to his family and home.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's strong ties to Water 7, making his eventual decision to join more meaningful.

bounties.reason: Involvement in the assault on Enies Lobby

reveals.information: First bounty of 44 million berries with epithet 'Cyborg'
Extended flashback showing how Franky rebuilt himself as a cyborg after his accident

keyMoments.title: Ship Construction Progress Update
keyMoments.description: Iceburg works with Franky and Galley-La foremen late into the night on the Straw Hat Pirates' new ship.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Iceburg's commitment to helping the Straw Hats and honoring Tom's legacy.

keyMoments.title: Tom's Legacy and Franky's Survival
keyMoments.description: Flashbacks show Iceburg's relationship with Tom and Franky as fellow apprentices under the legendary shipwright.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces Iceburg's connection to both Tom and Franky and their shared history.

keyMoments.title: Florian Triangle Introduction
keyMoments.description: Kokoro explains to the Straw Hats that they must traverse the dangerous Florian Triangle to reach Fish-Man Island.
keyMoments.significance: First mention of the Florian Triangle, foreshadowing the Thriller Bark arc.
keyMoments.quote: Hundreds of ships go missing in the Florian Triangle every year. Some say they vanish without a trace, while others are found adrift with no crew aboard.

keyMoments.title: Tom's Legacy and Franky's Survival
keyMoments.description: Tom appears in extended flashbacks showing his relationship with Franky and Iceburg, and his philosophy about shipbuilding.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces Tom's importance as a legendary shipwright and mentor.
keyMoments.quote: A man should never regret what he's built!
